channel.title: What is this place? on
channel.description: Recent content in What is this place? on

item.title: Nonthinking
item.description: What is it about? It is difficult to imagine functioning without the mind, despite the fact that it is useless. Dan Millman explains this brilliantly, explaining the difference between the mind and the brain, consciousness, being conscious and active attention:

item.title: Alfred 4
item.description: What is Alfred? [Optimization/Tools/Alfred]] is an overlay (or alternative) for Spotlight. With a paid extension (PowerPack), it allows you to connect to, for example, [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] or [[Spotify]].

Zakres w [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/JavaScript]] Seria filmów o fundamentalnym elemencie [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/JavaScript]]‘u: Zakresie ([[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Scope]]). Agenda [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Execution Context]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Scope]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Lexical Scope]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Closures]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Programowanie funkcyjne/Programowanie funkcyjne]] Seria filmów o programowaniu funkcyjnym w JavaScript

Źródła https://gabygoldberg.notion.site/f7050e62461143d49345e7b46eb5576b?v=c02511c4230c44ce9a1a03c9757da524 https://immersionden.xyz/ Kursy https://www.dappcamp.xyz/ Newslettery https://twitter.com/thedailygwei https://twitter.com/spencernoon https://twitter.com/coinmetrics

item.title: 1Password
item.description: What is 1Password? It is a paid password manager. From the perspective of online security, using the manager is very important.

item.title: 20 mile march
item.description: What is it about? [[Knowledge/Mental models/20 mile march]] is a concept from the book [[Knowledge/Books/Great by Choice]] ~ [[Knowledge/People/Jim Collins]]

item.title: A Few Lessons From Sherlock Holmes
A Little Book On The Human Shadow
Absent-mindedness
item.description: What is it about? It’s a state of low attention span and frequent distractions. How do I use [[Knowledge/Mental models/Absent-mindedness]]? In situations where I experience this, I usually go for a walk or just take a break.

item.title: Actor-observer bias
item.description: O co chodzi? O przypisywanie różnych powodów zachowań w zależności od tego czy utożsamiamy się z “aktorem” czy “obserwatorem”. Gdy jesteśmy aktorem, przypisujemy je do czynników zewnętrznych a będąc obserwatorem, wiążemy je z czynnikami wewnętrznymi.

item.title: Adam Grant
item.description: Author, among other things, of the brilliant book [[Knowledge/Books/Think Again]] - ‘Learning is as important as the ability to ODlearn’. A similar concept is touched upon in, among other books, [[The Code of Extraordinary Mind]] as ‘when have you changed any of your fundamental beliefs?

item.title: Adam Wathan
item.description: [[Knowledge/People/Adam Wathan]] is the creator of [[Tailwind CSS]], [[Tailwind UI]] and the author of a great e-book on UI design principles - [[Knowledge/Books/Refactoring UI]], among others.

item.title: Ahoy!
item.description: What is Ahoy? Ahoy! is a community we always wanted to be a part of. As a result of not finding such a place, we decided to create one ourselves.

item.title: AirBuddy
item.description: What is AirBuddy? AirBuddy is a simple app that makes it easy to manage AirPods headphones. I plugged in the keyboard shortcut responsible for connecting the headset under the Macbook, which made using them definitely more fun.

item.title: Airtable
item.description: What is Airtable? It’s a data storage application that resembles an Excel spreadsheet. Its biggest advantage is that it is built according to the [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] first approach, which works well in the context of [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]]

item.title: Alamanck of Naval Ravikant
item.description: Autor: Eric Jorgenson Context [[Knowledge/Books/Alamanck of Naval Ravikant]] is one of the books where marking valuable passages, ends up blurring the whole.

item.title: All I Want to Know is Where Im Going to Die So Ill Never Go There
item.description: One of the more interesting form of books I’ve read. The whole thing takes the form of a dialogue between [[Knowledge/People/Warren Buffet]], [[Knowledge/People/Charlie Munger]], a librarian, and a Seeker.

item.title: Ambiguity bias
item.description: O co chodzi? To sytuacja w której na podjętą decyzję ma wpływ posiadanie niewystarczającej ilości informacji. Wtedy decyzja zwykle wskazuje na opcję w przypadku której prawdopodobieństwo wyniku jest znane.

item.title: Andrew Huberman
item.description: A neuroscientist at Stanford University. He hosts a podcast Huberman Lab in which he talks about the latest scientific findings in a very accessible way, translating them into suggestions that can be easily put into practice.

item.title: Anecdotal fallacy
item.description: O co chodzi? Anecdotal Fallacy polega na przekonaniu, że jakieś zdarzenia mają większe prawdopodobieństwo wystąpienia, ponieważ nasze niedawne wspomnienia sugerują, że tak może być.

item.title: Anki
item.description: What is Anki? [Optimization/Tools/Anki]] is an application that facilitates memorization. It is based on the so-called [[Spaced Repetition]], which is repetition at intervals.

item.title: Anthropomorphism
item.description: What is it about? About attributing intentionality and mental states, characteristic of living creatures, to creatures that are not animate.

item.title: Antifragile
item.description: If we think of the opposite of fragility, strength or hardness comes to mind. In reality, however, even if we imagine a super-hard material, there is a good chance that we can find a harder one, use a weak point or leverage, to destroy or permanently damage it.

item.title: Anything You Want
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Anything You Want]] is a book that resonates with me incredibly. It talks about how a big vision, big funding, and a team full of experts are not necessary elements of business growth.

item.title: API
item.description: What is an API? Do you know what an interface is? It is a interface that enables you to communicate. E.

item.title: Appeal to Novelty
item.description: O co chodzi? It’s the belief that ’new is good or better'. How I use [[Knowledge/Mental models/Appeal to Novelty]]? I try to judge the usefulness of things not by their date of creation or discovery, but by their actual usefulness.

item.title: Appeal to probability fallacy
item.description: What is it about? It’s the tendency to consider something certain, simply because it’s likely. In other words: we overestimate the chance of an event occurring based on single signals that support it.

item.title: Argument from fallacy
item.description: What is it about? About the assumption that an argument containing a logical fallacy cannot have a true conclusion. E.g., if someone uses an illogical argument during a discusssion, we assume in advance that everything behind the message is also wrong.

item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description: Autor: James Clear Context Lessons The power of habit Chains of habits are too light to be felt, until they are too heavy to be broken

item.title: Audible
item.description: What is Audible? This is an app with Audiobooks, directly from Amazon. In my opinion, it is the best book listening app that exists on the market.

item.title: Authority bias
item.description: What is it about? Authority bias is the tendency to give higher effectiveness to the opinions of people with authority.

item.title: Automation
item.description: Every great software developer, for example, now has an army of robots working for him at nighttime while he or she sleeps, after they’ve written the code, and it’s cranking away.

item.title: Automation bias
item.description: What is it about? Automation bias refers to making mistakes in a highly automated environment where people trust machines more than their own judgment.

item.title: Balans
item.description: According to the [[Knowledge/Other/MBTI]] test, I have an INFJ profile, also known as an ’extremity profile’ or ‘paradox profile’. For this reason, understanding and using [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Balance]]is fundamentally important to me.

item.title: Better Touch Tool
item.description: What is the Better Touch Tool? This is an application that allows you to set up advanced gestures on your trackpad.

item.title: Biznes
item.description: Biznes Creating a company is a way for me to realize all my ideas and it is a way to live according to my [[Foundations/Values]]

item.title: Black Box Thinking
item.description: [[Antifragility]] (eng. [[Knowledge/Books/Antifragile]]) explains very clearly to us why airplane flights are so safe. One of the main reasons is that every mistake or disaster that occurs contributes to the creation of new [[Policies]] and procedures that minimize their recurrence and strengthen the entire system.

item.title: Blink
item.description: For as long as I can remember [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Intuition]] has played a key role in my life and since I realized this, I have been intentionally observing its presence and exploring all available materials on it.

item.title: Body Mind Mastery
item.description: What do mind and body have in common? Everything. We mistakenly treat our mind and body independently, while they are one.

item.title: Books
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Way of The Peaceful Warrior]] [[Knowledge/Books/Alamanck of Naval Ravikant]] [[Knowledge/Books/Antifragile]] [[Knowledge/Books/Black Box Thinking]] [[Knowledge/Books/Cant Hurt Me]] [[Knowledge/Books/Body Mind Mastery]] [[Knowledge/Books/Daring Greatly]] [[Knowledge/Books/Creativity Inc]] [[Knowledge/Books/Deep Work]] [[Knowledge/Books/Deviate]] [[Knowledge/Books/Getting Real]] [[Knowledge/Books/The Infinite Game]] [[Knowledge/Books/Good to Great]] [[Knowledge/Books/Leaders Eat Last]] [[Knowledge/Books/MAKE]] [[Knowledge/Books/Never Split the Difference]] [[Knowledge/Books/Predictably Irrational]] [[Knowledge/Books/Principles]] [[Knowledge/Books/Think Like a Rocket Scientist]] [[Knowledge/Books/Rebel Ideas]] [[Knowledge/Books/Seeking Wisdom]] [[Knowledge/Books/Simplify]] [[Knowledge/Books/So Good They Cant Ignore You]] [[Knowledge/Books/The Mom Test]] [[Knowledge/Books/The Brain Audit]] [[Knowledge/Books/The Compound Effect]] [[Knowledge/Books/Understanding the INFJ Personality Type]] [[Knowledge/Books/War of Art]] [[Knowledge/Books/When Coffee and Kale Compete]] [[Knowledge/Books/Who Says Elephant’s Can’t Dance]] [[Knowledge/Books/Total Recall]] [[Knowledge/Books/How to Fail at Almost Anything and Still Win Big]] [[Knowledge/Books/All I Want to Know is Where Im Going to Die So Ill Never Go There]] [[Knowledge/Books/Blink]] [[Knowledge/Books/Skin in the Game]] [[Knowledge/Books/Range]] [[Knowledge/Books/Insanely Simple]] [[Knowledge/Books/Inspired]] [[Knowledge/Books/Personal MBA]] [[Knowledge/Books/Shape Up]] [[Knowledge/Books/Hard Things About Hard Things]] [[Knowledge/Books/Rework]] [[Knowledge/Books/Fooled by Randomness]] [[Knowledge/Books/Power vs.

item.title: Boredom
item.description: Sources https://thriveglobal.com/stories/three-ways-to-reset-your-stress-in-any-situation

item.title: Bruce Lee
item.description: [[Knowledge/Podcasts/Bruce Lee Podcast]]

item.title: Bruce Lee Podcast
item.description: A podcast about the philosophy of [[Knowledge/People/Bruce Lee]] hosted by his daughter Shannon Lee. I often return to selected episodes. It’s timeless knowledge that can be rediscovered and learned again and again.

item.title: Buffer
item.description: What is a Buffer? [[Optimization/Tools/Buffer]] is a service with the help of which I publish almost all posts in all social channels.

item.title: Bullets and Cannonballs
item.description: [[Knowledge/Mental models/Bullets and Cannonballs]] to koncept z książki [[Knowledge/Books/Great by Choice]] ~ [[Knowledge/People/Jim Collins]] O co chodzi? Najpierw strzelaj małymi pociskami (niskie koszty, niskie ryzyko) aby ocenić co działa a co nie.

item.title: Cant Hurt Me
item.description: [[Can’t Hurt Me]] is the autobiography of [[Knowledge/People/David Goggins]]who shows with his entire life where [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Discipline]] and extreme hard work can take us.

item.title: Cel
item.description: Goals are recognized as essential elements for achieving great results. Personally, I gave up on designating them at the beginning of 2019, when, doing a recap of the previous year, I asked myself ‘**Can it be done differently?

item.title: Charlie Munger
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/All I Want to Know is Where Im Going to Die So Ill Never Go There]]

item.title: Circle of Competence
item.description: O co chodzi? Każdy z nas posiada pewien zestaw umiejętności oraz wiedzy. Wiedza o tym, gdzie ten “obszar komptencji” ma swoje granice, pozwala lepiej go wykorzystywać oraz sięgać po pomoc innych wtedy, gdy to potrzebne.

item.title: ClickUp
item.description: What is ClickUp? This is a powerful application for managing tasks in a team. I currently do not use it due to the fact that it offers much more capabilities than I need.

item.title: Closures
item.description: title: Closures Zobacz również: [[Execution Stack]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Lexical Scope]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Scope]]

item.title: Commitment Bias
item.description: O co chodzi? O kontynuowanie swoich działań pomimo pojawienia się nowych faktów, które je podważają lub nawet jasno wskazują, że są błędne.

item.title: Constructor Functions
item.description: Definicja [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Fundamenty/Constructor Functions]] to funkcja zwracająca nowy obiekt, wywołana z pomocą słowa kluczowego new. Jej nazwę zapisujemy z wielkiej litery. Rolą constructora jest utworzenie nowej instancji klasy, do której jest przypisany.

item.title: Craftsman Mindset
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/So Good They Cant Ignore You]]

item.title: Creativity Inc
item.description: [[Creativity.inc]] is a book written by the founder of Pixar. The company we all know very well from animated blockbusters.

item.title: Cron
item.description: Cron is a calendar designed similarly to [[Optimization/Tools/Superhuman]], facilitating quick event planning and calendar management. https://cron.com/

item.title: Curiosity
item.description: What is Curiosity to me? Curiosity overcomes all limitations and leads to unimaginable places. It is the absolute foundation of my functioning.

item.title: Curse of knowledge
item.description: O co chodzi? Klątwa wiedzy to błąd poznawczy polegający na założeniu, że inni dysponują wiedzą, która umożliwi im zrozumienie tego, co chcemy przekazać.

item.title: Dan Millman
item.description: Who is he? Dan Millman is a World Champion in gymnastics and author of books in which he makes strong references to Buddhist philosophy.

item.title: Daring Greatly
item.description: This book teaches something important: **[[Vulnerability]] is the greatest Courage. At first glance this may sound absurd, because most often vulnerability is equated with weakness.

item.title: David Goggins
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Cant Hurt Me]]

item.title: Deep Work
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Deep Work]] is one of my most recommended books. I believe that virtually everyone should read it. We live in a world full of distractions - from notifications to bad habits of reaching for the phone every few minutes.

item.title: Design Maestro
item.description: What is Design Maestro? This is a set of macros for [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]], designed for designers working in [[Optimization/Tools/Figma]] and [[Optimization/Tools/Webflow]] and using the capabilities of [[macOS]].

item.title: Design System
item.description: Design System Currently, I design almost exclusively based on so-called Design Systems, such as [[Tailwind UI]] or [[Systemflow]]. This makes it easy for me to create a clear [[Knowledge/Design/UI]], maintaining consistency, which positively affects the overall [[Knowledge/Design/UX]] of the application.

item.title: Deviate
item.description: Is what we see [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Reality]]? The answer to this question seems obvious. After all, we can see, we can touch, we can hear, we can taste, and it exists.

item.title: Dictionary
item.description: [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Goal]] [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Direction]] [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Process]] [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Surrounding]] [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Perspective]] [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Indie Hackers]] [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Balance]]

item.title: Digital Ocean
item.description: This is the hosting I use for virtually every one of my projects. I also have a developer server that I use for learning and various types of testing.

item.title: Direction
item.description: What is a Direction? Direction has replaced my [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Goal]]s. Now, instead of specifying smaller or larger points I am aiming for, I have a clear direction in which I am heading.

item.title: Disappointment
item.description: Disenchantment or more Roz-Enchantment literally means release from enchantment, that is, breaking out of the illusion. In other words, the moment of disillusionment is the moment when we see [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Reality]] as it is and not as we think it is.

item.title: Discipline
item.description: What is it about? Discipline falls very often in the context of successful implementation of [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Goal]]s. In practice, I am closer to the point of view of [[Knowledge/People/Jocko Willink]], who said that ‘Discipline gives freedom’ and emphasized it very clearly in his book [[Knowledge/Books/Extreme Ownership]].

item.title: Dropshare
item.description: This is an application that allows you to quickly upload screenshots and files to an FTP server. In my case, I am connecting to the VPS [[Optimization/Tools/Digital Ocean]].

item.title: Dunning-Kurger effect
item.description: O co chodzi? O iluzję kompetencji wynikają z niewystarczającej wiedzy oraz doświadczenia, w wybranym temacie. Inaczej mówiąc, osoby początkujące uważają się za bardziej kompetentne niż faktycznie są.

item.title: EasyBanner
item.description: What is EasyBanner? EasyBanner is my microservice to generate jpg / png / pdf files based on HTML / CSS code.

item.title: EasyCart
item.description: What is EasyCart? EasyCart is a project that facilitates sales in digital products. Its biggest competitive advantage is its UX (e.

item.title: EasyLegal
item.description: What is EasyLegal? EasyLegal is a tool for generating the Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy necessary for the operation of the website and store.

item.title: EasyLove
item.description: What is EasyLove? It’s a tool that facilitates the process of collecting and sharing customer reviews. Customer reviews are one of the most essential elements of marketing and sales and yet they are often overlooked or lost amidst emails and Social Media comments.

item.title: EasyTimer
item.description: What is EasyTimer? It is a generator of countdown timers that can be used in email campaigns. The application generates a timer that counts down to the indicated date.

item.title: eduweb
item.description: [[Projects/eduweb]] is a project that I have been involved in since April 2020. It has a special meaning for me, because it was on eduweb that I started to seriously learn programming.

item.title: Emotions
item.description: Context A few years ago, I learned that my nervous system is slightly more active than most people’s. In other words: I feel more.

item.title: Endel.io
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.io]] is an application that uses [AI] to generate sounds to help with focus, among other things. I reach for it almost every day.

item.title: Equipment
item.description: Context When buying equipment, I take into account first and foremost how much it will affect my existing operation. I very much agree with the opinion of Greg Rog, which clearly shows that for professional use, it makes sense to choose the best available equipment that is within our financial reach and needs.

item.title: Ergodicity
item.description: O co chodzi? Ergodyczność to cecha procesów w przypadku których wystarczy pojedyncza, losowa i wystarczająco duża próba, aby przewidzieć efekt końcowy całości.

item.title: Essentialism
item.description: O co chodzi? Esencjalizm to model mentalny omawiany w książce [[Knowledge/Books/Essentialism]]. Polega na usprawnieniu procesu podejmowania decyzji poprzez [[Eliminacja]] zbędnych elementów oraz [[Upraszczanie]].

item.title: Essentialism - The Disciplined Pursuit of Less
Execution Context
item.description: To abstrakcyjny koncept środowiska w którym interpretowany i wykonywany jest kod [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/JavaScript]]. Za każdym razem gdy uruchamiamy kod JS, dzieje się to w [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Execution Context]]

item.title: expectations
item.description: No expectations I live without expectations, being prepared for anything. I execute my [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Process]] to the best of my ability, and because of this I have the conviction that every day I am doing something that develops me.

item.title: Extreme Ownership
item.description: [Knowledge/Books/Extreme Ownership]] is one book I do not recommend reading. I definitely recommend listening to the original audiobook, read by the authors!

item.title: Factory Functions
item.description: Definicja [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Programowanie funkcyjne/Factory Functions]] to funkcja zwracająca (z założenia) nowy obiekt. Taka funkcja nie jest ani klasą ([[JavaScript Class]]) ani constructorem.

item.title: Figma
item.description: This is currently one of the best interface design applications (if not the best). How do I use Figma? I usually use design systems, such as [[Systemflow]].

item.title: First Principles
item.description: O co chodzi? O myślenie w kategoriach fundamentalnych prawd składających się na wybrane zagadnienie i budowanie rozwiązań w oparciu o nie.

item.title: Fooled by Randomness
item.description: Usually we don’t even realize how huge an impact randomness has on our lives. And the important word here is ‘huge’ and not total.

item.title: Framer Sites
item.description: This is a potential successor to [[Optimization/Tools/Webflow]]. I am currently watching the development of this project and treat it as a curiosity.

item.title: Getting Real
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Getting Real]] is a book that resonates with me on an unprecedented level, and I can confidently subscribe to almost everything written there.

item.title: Getting to know yourself
item.description: Temet Nosce (ltn. Know Thyself) Context ⚠️ Personality tests are tools. They don’t define anything, they just point out useful parts.

item.title: git
item.description: [[Knowledge/Programming/git/git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Zapisywanie zmian w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Przestrzeń robocza i stage w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Przywracanie zmian w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Przeglądanie historii w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Komentarze w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Polecenie stash w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Branche w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Zdalne repozytorium w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Rozwiązywanie konfliktów w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Rebase w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Tagi w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Cofanie zmian w git]] [[Knowledge/Programming/git/Git Hooks]]

item.title: Gladiators, Pirates and Games of Trust
item.description: [[Game Theory]]

item.title: Good to Great
item.description: [[Knowledge/People/Jim Collins]]

item.title: Hard Things About Hard Things
item.description: How difficult is running a company? Only those who run a company can find out. We are talking here not only about keeping a cool head during a crisis, but the constant exposure to the fact that ‘something may stop working’ and the responsibility for this will fall solely on the CEO.

item.title: Having
item.description: “I already have everything!” Getting to the point when I can say ‘I already have everything’ is fine in one case only: **when it doesn’t depend on what I actually have.

item.title: Hazel
item.description: [Optimization/Tools/Hazel]] is an application for automatic file organization. It allows you to define rules for individual folders. According to these rules, it is possible to rename according to certain schemes, move between folders or even run any [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/JavaScript]] scripts.

item.title: Headphones
item.description: For me, headphones are an essential part of good [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Focus]], especially in combination with [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.io]], [[Optimization/Tools/Session]] and ANC (Active Noise Cancelling) technology.

item.title: Headspace
item.description: It’s an app for Mindfulness, breathing exercises and calming. I use it practically every day. Particularly noteworthy here is a quote by [[Knowledge/People/Ray Dalio]], according to whom transcendental meditation is one of the main reasons behind his success.

item.title: Hedgehog Concept
item.description: [[Knowledge/People/Jim Collins]] [[Knowledge/Books/Good to Great]]

item.title: Higher-Order Function
item.description: title: Higher order function

item.title: How to Fail at Almost Anything and Still Win Big
item.description: One of the most important advantages of reading books is the ability to learn from the experiences of other, often outstanding people.

item.title: Huberman Lab
item.description: [[Knowledge/Podcasts/Huberman Lab]] is a podcast by Dr. [[Knowledge/People/Andrew Huberman]] in whose episodes he addresses a single topic on a daily function or important process for the body, while giving practical tips that can be easily translated into action.

item.title: Humor effect
item.description: O co chodzi? Lepiej zapamiętujemy rzeczy, które postrzegamy jako zabawne / absurdalne. Jak wykorzystuję [[Knowledge/Mental models/Humor effect]]? Po pierwsze jedną z moich [[Foundations/Values]] jest entuzjazm, który pomaga mi pokonywać przeciwności oraz nieustannie działać poza swoją strefą komfortu.

item.title: Hyper.is
item.description: It is a terminal created in HTML/CSS/JS. I like it a lot, but its performance is not satisfactory. Recently it was completely replaced by [[Warp.

item.title: iA Writer
item.description: It’s a markdown editor geared toward a minimalist interface and high focus when writing. How do I use iA Writer? In combination with [[Optimization/Tools/Session]] and [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.

item.title: Indie Hackers
item.description: [Knowledge/Dictionary/India Hackers]] is a community of individuals running side projects or developing products alone or in very small teams. They most often take the [[Bootstrapping]] route instead of external funding.

item.title: Intellij
item.description: What is IntelliJ? It’s an IDE created by JetBrains that, in my opinion, is the best tool for developers, and I find it hard to explain why so many people still use Visual Studio Code.

item.title: Intuition
item.description: What is it about? According to [[Foundations/Understanding myself#MBTI]], my profile is INFJ. Other personality tests confirm a very high use of intuition.

item.title: Inversion
item.description: [[Knowledge/Mental models/Inversion]] O co chodzi? O myślenie odwrotne. Za każdym razem gdy podejmujesz decyzję czy rozwiązujesz problem, spróbuj odwracać swoje myślenie na różne sposoby.

item.title: iPad
item.description: The iPad is, in my opinion, one of the best pieces of electronic music I have ever encountered. Applications [[Optimization/Tools/Kindle]] - if I have a tablet with me, I read on it [[Optimization/Tools/Notability]] - I keep a [[Foundations/📓 Journal]] almost every day just on the iPad using the Apple Pencil [[Optimization/Tools/Procreate]] - in my spare time and on trips I draw In addition, I have virtually no applications installed on the iPad other than those mentioned above.

item.title: iPhone
item.description: For the past few years, my main phone has been an iPhone and I find it hard to imagine going back to Android or alternatives.

item.title: Jim Collins
item.description: Concepts

item.title: Jocko Willink
item.description: Author of books [[Knowledge/Books/Extreme Ownership]] i [[Dichotomy of Leadership]]

item.title: Journal
item.description: I keep a journal on [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]] in an application called [[Optimization/Tools/Notability]]. I wrote my first notes still in the [[Bear]] app back in 2016.

item.title: Keyboard Maestro
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] is an application I use to automate many tasks within the OSX operating system. I use it together with [[Optimization/Tools/Alfred]] and [[Optimization/Hardware/StreamDeck]].

item.title: Kindle
item.description: This is the application in which I read all [[Knowledge/Books/Books]] on both [[Optimization/Hardware/iPhone]] and [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]]. Most of the quotes I publish are just from the highglights marked in this application.

item.title: Knowledge acquisition system
item.description: I see the ability to acquire knowledge quickly as one of the most important, especially in the face of a very fast-changing world.

item.title: Leaders Eat Last
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Leaders Eat Last]] is a book in which [[Simon Sinek]] presents [[Knowledge/Business/Leadership]] in a view I identify with myself. It is largely based on experiences a from military areas with a focus on special units such as [[Navy Seal’s]].

item.title: Leadership
item.description: I believe that each of us is or should be a leader for ourselves and others. It has little to do with our position or social standing.

item.title: letting go
item.description: What is it about? [Knowledge/Thoughts/Emotions]] play an important role in our lives and, in my opinion, serve us as long as we don’t let them take full control.

item.title: Leverage
item.description: O co chodzi? Mechanizm dźwigni (eng. [[Knowledge/Mental models/Leverage]]) pozawala na wygenerowanie efektu nierproporcjonalnie dużego do włożonej siły. Dajcie mi punkt podparcia a poruszę ziemię ~ Archimedes

item.title: Lex Fridman Podcast
item.description: [Knowledge/People/Lex Fridman]] The podcast is one of my favorites mainly because of the presenter and his approach to life with which I very much identify.

item.title: Lexical Scope
item.description: title: Lexical Scope

item.title: Loss aversion
item.description: O co chodzi? Doceniamy bardziej to co już posiadamy w porównaniu do tego, co możemy zyskać.

item.title: Macbook
item.description: Context MacBook is the most important work tool for me. For years I worked on Windows but since I bought my first MacBook, I can’t imagine going back.

item.title: Made You Think
item.description: Made You Think is a podcast about interesting books and the presenters’ thoughts on them. What sets it apart is the very well-chosen titles and great, in-depth discussions that touch on the most important concepts raised by the authors of the books discussed.

item.title: Magnet
item.description: This is a window manager that I use together with [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] to organize my work on [[Optimization/Hardware/Macbook]]. An alternative is Mosaic, available in the Setapp package.

item.title: MAKE
item.description: Autor: Pieter Levels Context [Pieter Levels]] is one of the most recognized in the [[Knowledge/Dictionary/India Hackers]] community. He has created [https://nomadlist.

item.title: MakeHQ
item.description: Integromat is the most important automation tool I use. With it, I connect all services that have [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] using either built-in modules or connecting directly through [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] via the HTTP module.

item.title: Marketing
item.description: E-mail marketing https://chasedimond.com/welcome-series-guide-for-nonbuyers Books [[Knowledge/Books/The Brain Audit]] [[Knowledge/Books/Simplify]] [[Knowledge/Books/Insanely Simple]] [[Knowledge/Books/Predictably Irrational]]

item.title: MBTI
item.description: MBTI This is a popular and free personality test on which I base [[Foundations/Understanding myself]] and [[Foundations/Process]] Very often I encounter negative opinions about it and examples of undermining its effectiveness.

item.title: Mental models
item.description: [[Knowledge/Mental models/Mental models]] improve my thought process, especially in the context of decision-making and problem-solving. Źródła https://untools.co/ishikawa-diagram https://junto.

item.title: Microservices
item.description: Generating graphics Initially, for my own purposes, I designed a microservice that generates optimized creatives based on a special template. Later, the project was extended to a module in [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] and is now available to others under the name [[Projects/EasyBanner]].

item.title: MindNode
item.description: This is the best mindmapping application I know of available for [[macOS]].

item.title: Moment of Realization
item.description: What is the Moment of Realization? This is the moment when knowledge turns into action. That is, it’s not what you know that matters, but what you do with it.

item.title: MVP
item.description: Sources: Uprzedzenia i błędy myślowe przy budowaniu MVP

item.title: My First Million
item.description: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/my-first-million/id1469759170

item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/Airtable]] - API first excel na sterydach [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] - The best tool for automating and quickly combining [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] [[Optimization/Tools/Zapier]] - Automation and quick linking [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] - Automations in OSX [[Optimization/Tools/Romwod]] - Application with stretching exercise program [[Optimization/Tools/Raycast]] - Launcher w którym tworzę własne rozszerzenia w [[Knowledge/Programming/Node.

item.title: Naval Ravikant
item.description: Naval & Kapil Gupta “There is a way to solve all your problems without moving a finger. It’s all about exposure.

item.title: Never Split the Difference
item.description: [Knowledge/Thoughts/Negotiations]] are often associated by us only with selected professions (e.g., the role of a salesman), and there are people who believe that for them it will not bring any value.

item.title: NFT
item.description: API https://docs.nftport.xyz Stripe dla NFT

item.title: Node.js
item.description: [[Knowledge/Programming/NestJS/Upload plików]]

item.title: Notability
item.description: This is a note-taking app designed for [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]]. I’ve been using it since 2017 and I keep my [[Foundations/Diary]] in it.

item.title: Notion
item.description: This is a note-taking application, which is now an extensive tool in which I organize all my projects. Its biggest advantage is access to [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] and the ability to connect with [[Optimization/Tools/Raycast]] and [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] to create your own [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]].

item.title: Oak
item.description: This is a free app for [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]] that I use to implement my [[Foundations/Process]] and specifically stress-reducing breathing exercises. I use it in parallel with [[Optimization/Tools/Headspace]] (not simultaneously)

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: What is Obsidian? Simply put, it’s a note-taking application. Its main advantages are that it works on local [[markdown]] files and allows connections between notes through so-called ‘wiki links’.

item.title: Occams Razor
item.description: O co chodzi? [[Knowledge/Mental models/Occams Razor]] to model mentalny według którego najprostsze rozwiązania są najlepsze. Nie jest to jednak złota reguła, lecz bardziej “rule of thumb”.

item.title: Odwrócenie
item.description: At every turn, I notice how big a role reversal (eng. [[Knowledge/Mental models/Inversion]]) plays, and the longer I use it, the more I understand why people like [[Knowledge/People/Warren Buffet]] value it so much.

item.title: Onyx
item.description: This is an application for [[macOS]] that I run once every few months to clean the system of unnecessary items.

item.title: Optimization
item.description: [[Foundations/Process]] [[Optimization/Hardware/Hardware]] [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]] [[Optimization/Tools/Narzędzia]]

item.title: Optymalizacja front-endu
item.description: Źródła https://wpostats.com/

item.title: overment
item.description: overment is a YouTube channel dedicated to programmers. The whole project is based on the most important principle for me which is [[Respect for Time]] both mine and others.

item.title: Paste
item.description: This is the best clipboard manager for [[macOS]] that I know of. It saves the history of system clipboard changes and allows easy searching.

item.title: People
item.description: I care about being surrounded by people whose presence has a positive impact on me. Below is a list of people I follow online.

item.title: Perspective
item.description: Perspective is one of the most important tools I use (right next to [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Intuition]]). Being able to adjust it is extremely important to me because of my current beliefs about [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Reality]].

item.title: Podcast
item.description: Podcasty Personally, I am not fond of podcasts, with the exceptions listed below. I am also much more appealed to podcasts in very concise forms or very strictly defined topics, rather than entertaining podcasts or podcasts conducted without prior preparation.

item.title: Podstawy
item.description: Instalacja Zainstalowanie CLI: npm i -g @nestjs/cli Utworzenie nowego projektu nest new [nazwa] Struktura projektu Podstawową struktury kodu w NestJS są klasy (eng.

item.title: Principles
item.description: What principles do you follow in life? How do you make decisions and how do you learn from your mistakes?

item.title: Principles You
item.description: Principles You Personality test prepared by [[Knowledge/People/Ray Dalio]] and [[Knowledge/People/Adam Grant]] https://principlesyou.com/

item.title: Process
item.description: I operate on the basis of a proprietary [[Knowledge/Dictionary/Process]], designed with me in mind. I am constantly questioning, modifying and improving it.

item.title: Procreate
item.description: This is an application for [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]] in which I draw as a hobby and create elements for videos for [[Projects/overment]] or [[Projects/eduweb]].

item.title: Product Development

item.title: Prototype chain
item.description: Prototypy umożliwiają tworzenie obiektów, które współdzielą metody w celu oszczędzenia pamięci. Możliwe jest łączenie ze sobą prototypów w celu dodatkowego zaoszczędzenia pamięci.

item.title: Przestrzeń robocza i stage w git
Radical Transparency
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Principles]] [[Knowledge/People/Ray Dalio]]

item.title: Range
item.description: The world is complicated, and it’s hard to deny that. In addition, over the past few decades, technology has accelerated the overall development of almost every area of our lives, bringing about significant changes in the blink of an eye.

item.title: Ray Dalio
item.description: Rules Ray Dalio’s book [[Knowledge/Books/Principles]] helped me understand the importance of having principles in my life that guide me. With rules, we improve our decision-making process, which leads us to achieve better results.

item.title: Raycast
item.description: Raycast is a launcher that has almost entirely replaced [[Optimization/Tools/Alfred]] and largely replaces [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]]. Its biggest advantage for me is:

item.title: Reality
item.description: Context Many sources (e.g. [[Knowledge/Books/Deviate]]) indicate that we do not have the ability to perceive reality as it is and each of us sees it differently.

item.title: Rebel Ideas
item.description: Solving an eminently complex problem with an extremely simple solution sounds like a display of genius or luck. How is it in reality?

item.title: Rest
item.description: [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/REST]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Resources]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Adresy URL]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Metody HTTP]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Statusy HTTP]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Przykład REST]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Paginacja REST]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Sortowanie i filtrowanie REST]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Wyszukiwanie REST]] [[Knowledge/Programming/REST/Autoryzacja i uwierzytelnienie REST]]

item.title: Reveri
item.description: Reveri is an application recommended by [[Knowledge/People/Andrew Huberman]] for self-hypnosis. I use it in parallel with [[Optimization/Tools/Headspace]] and [[Optimization/Tools/Oak]].

item.title: Rize
item.description: Rize is an application that works similarly to RescueTime. Running in the background, it monitors activities on your computer and measures the time spent in particular applications/websites.

item.title: Rocket
item.description: Rocket is an emoji picker for [[macOS]]. I use it because it works much faster than the system picker.

item.title: Rust
item.description: https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/

item.title: RxJS
item.description: https://www.learnrxjs.io/ https://rxviz.com/

item.title: Sales
item.description: Books [[Knowledge/Books/Personal MBA]] [[Knowledge/Books/Never Split the Difference]] [[Knowledge/Books/The Brain Audit]]

item.title: Scenarios
item.description: Publishing posts on Social Media I publish most of the posts with the help of [[Optimization/Tools/Buffer]] to which the data goes automatically from [[Optimization/Tools/Airtable]] thanks to [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]].

item.title: Scope
item.description: title: Scope Zobacz również: [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Lexical Scope]] Pure Functions Function Composition Currying Shared State Composition over Inheritance Factory Functions Funktory Monady

item.title: Screenflow
item.description: Screenflow is a screen recording application that I use to record and edit screencasts.

item.title: Second Order Thinking
item.description: O co chodzi? Myślenie z uwzględnieniem konsekwencji drugiego rzędu skupia się nie tylko na dojściu do rozwiązania ale również zaadresowania konsekwencji opracowanego rezultatu.

item.title: Seeking Wisdom
item.description: Autor: Peter Bevelin [[Knowledge/Books/Seeking Wisdom]] the absolute best book I’ve read on the subject of improving thinking and decision-making processes ([[Knowledge/Mental models/Mental models]]).

item.title: Sendgrid
item.description: Sendgrid is the best email system I know of, which I use by automating [[Optimization/Tools/Raycast]] and [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]].

item.title: Session
item.description: Session is a pomodoro session application that I use in parallel with [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.io]] to focus on my work (deep work - read more: [[Knowledge/Books/Deep Work]])

item.title: Simplify
item.description: ‘Something is simple not when you ignore some elements, but when, reaching the source, you consciously reject the unnecessary ones’ ~ overment

item.title: Skin in the Game
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Skin in the Game]] is a term for risk-informed engagement in pursuit of a set goal. The book itself phenomenally presents the fact that we can’t be 100% sure of anything.

item.title: Skupienie (Focus)
item.description: What is Focus for me? I see the ability to focus as one of the most important skills we can develop in ourselves.

item.title: Slack
item.description: It’s a communicator I use in my day-to-day work but also in [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]] with [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]], where my robot team reports to me in real time on activities undertaken and in some situations communicates asking me to take specific actions.

item.title: So Good They Cant Ignore You
item.description: ‘Follow your passion’ is popular but counterintuitively very poor advice and even … dangerous. Above all, [[Cal Newport]] believes that passion does not come out of nowhere, but emerges over time as we become progressively better at what we already do.

item.title: Social comparsion bias
item.description: O co chodzi? O odczuwanie negatywnych emocji w sytuacji gdy ktoś inny jest w jakiś sposób lepszy od nas. Jak wykorzystuję [[Knowledge/Mental models/Social comparsion bias]]?

item.title: Stream Deck
item.description: What is StreamDeck? Elgato StreamDeck is a kind of auxiliary keyboard, on the keys of which you can display any graphics, including dynamic ones (automatic replacement of photo and description).

item.title: StrenghtsFinder
item.description: StrengthsFinder Along with [[Knowledge/Other/MBTI]], [[Knowledge/Other/The Big Five]] and [[UnderstandMyself]], this is the most important tool I used in the [[Foundations/Understanding myself]] process.

item.title: Sunk cost fallacy
item.description: O co chodzi? O naszą tendencję do kontynuowania działania, pomimo tego że poniesione koszty znacznie przewyższają już ewentualne korzyści jakie możemy uzyskać w przyszłości.

item.title: Superhuman
item.description: Czym jest Superhuman? Superhuman is a great email client focused on high efficiency through support for keyboard shortcuts and a superbly optimized UI.

item.title: SyntaxFM
item.description: SyntaxFM is a podcast about web development hosted by Wes Bos and Scott Tolinsky.

item.title: The Brain Audit
item.description: Autor: Sean D’Souza If I had to read just one book to understand sales, it would be this book. At the same time, it is not just a book about sales, but also about how to design solutions to IMPORTANT problems and how to communicate them in order to attract the attention of ideal customers and address their objections using, for example, the so-called ‘‘reverse references’’.

item.title: The Code Of The Extraordinary Mind
The Dichotomy of Leadership
item.description: Jocko and Leif’s first book, [[Knowledge/Books/Extreme Ownership]], presents leadership through the lens of extremes, so [[Knowledge/Books/The Dichotomy of Leadership]] elaborates on the topic by drawing attention to a key element of the whole: BALANCE.

item.title: The Infinite Game
item.description: There are two types of games: The kind we play to win As well as those in which we play to stay in the game.

item.title: The Map Is Not the Territory
item.description: O co chodzi? [[Knowledge/Mental models/The Map Is Not the Territory]] to koncepcja mówiąca o tym, że mapa rzeczywistości nie jest rzeczywistością.

item.title: The Mom Test
item.description: They say that asking our own mother if our idea for a new business is a good one is not very wise.

item.title: Think Like a Rocket Scientist
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/Think Like a Rocket Scientist]] Can you think? I guess that’s something anyone can do, right? And don’t you sometimes think that others do it better than you?

item.title: This Book Will Teach You How To Write Better
TokKast
item.description: ToKast is a podcast devoted entirely to the books [[Knowledge/Books/The Beginning of Infinity]] and [[Knowledge/Books/The Fabric of Reality]]. Quite poor technically but everything is made up for by top-notch content.

item.title: Tools
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] MakeHQ (formerly Integromat) is the best platform I know for easily connecting services through [[Knowledge/Programming/API]]. Its most important features are webhooks, an http module that allows you to connect to any application, and a great API that I use for my own extensions.

item.title: Total Recall
item.description: Without a doubt one of the best biographies I have read so far. Lessons [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Discipline]] is fundamentally important… …To implement small steps every day….

item.title: UI
item.description: How do I design the UI? For UI design, I currently use almost exclusively [[Optimization/Tools/Figma]] in conjunction with the [[Tailwind UI]] component library.

item.title: Understanding the INFJ Personality Type
item.description: A few years ago I heard about the MBTI personality test, while it was only later after taking the ‘Gallup’ test that I realized how much guidance such tools give us.

item.title: Upload plików
item.description: Upload plików w Nest.js z Multer

item.title: UX
item.description: Sources https://learnux.io/ Human Interface Guidelines [[Projects/Ahoy!]] https://www.nngroup.com/articles/

item.title: Values
item.description: My fundamental values facilitate my decision-making during the [[Foundations/Process]] and moving in the [[Foundations/Direction]] I set out Each of the following values is equally important to me and unchanging throughout my life.

item.title: Via Negativa
item.description: O co chodzi? [[Knowledge/Mental models/Via Negativa]] to proces upraszczania poprzez usuwanie lub unikanie zbędnych elementów. Według [[Nassim Nicholas Taleb]] w filozofii [[Knowledge/Mental models/Via Negativa]] to skupianie się na tym, czym coś nie jest a w przypadku działania - na tym, czego należy unikać, nie robić lub odejmować.

item.title: War of Art
item.description: Autor: Steven Pressfield Are you aware of the existence of a certain force that constantly holds you back? It’s hidden under one of many masks - fear, anxiety, fatigue, excuses, lack of vitality or more important matters - [[Resistance]], whose primary goal is to destroy us and stop us from acting altogether.

item.title: Warren Buffet
item.description: [[Knowledge/Books/All I Want to Know is Where Im Going to Die So Ill Never Go There]]

item.title: Way of The Peaceful Warrior
item.description: [Knowledge/Books/Way of The Peaceful Warrior]] is one of the most important books for me. Its narrative resonates very much with me and has had a huge impact on me over the years.

item.title: Who Says Elephant's Can't Dance
item.description: [Knowledge/Business/Leadership]] is a topic I have read about in many books. Throughout almost my entire career to date, I have had the opportunity to observe many managers and leaders.

item.title: Zakres
item.description: [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Lexical Scope]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Scope]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Execution Context]] [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/Zakres/Closures]]

item.title: zautomatyzowani
item.description: [[Projects/zautomatyzowani]] is a project that I set up together with [[Grzegorz Róg]] ([[Projects/eduweb]]) to demonstrate our approach to [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]], The use of [[Knowledge/Programming/No-Code]] tools and doing business online more broadly.
